result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Kenneth R Sobbe in court with attorney Patrick K Ritter.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.

COSIGNED BY FATHER, ROBERT SOBBE  DOB: 12/15/72, WITH PHOTO ID AND MOTHER, DAWN SOBBE DOB: 2/17/76, WITH PHOTO ID

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  No contact with the victim, AJS (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 3/1/16:  NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM, AJS, PERSON, PROPERTY, RESIDENCE OR FAMILY OR THE OTHER VICTIM.    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances - bond condition(s) to be monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc., located at 524 S Main Street in Racine (262-632-1780).  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.    Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons, all weapons are to be removed from the home.    Defendant must attend self help groups, 5 per week, in Burlington.     Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Preliminary hearing at 04-06-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Kenneth R Sobbe in court with attorney Patrick K Ritter.  Bridget D. Brave for Lillian Lewis appears for the State of Wisconsin   Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.   Defense req. another STC date.  2 new cases have been filed against this defendant with 2 active warrants, 16CF292 and 16CF293.  Both cases are added to the courts calendar and copies provided to the parties.  RWIN.  Warrants vacated.  States recommendation for bail is some cash bond.  Defense requests minimal cash bond.  Parents are asked questions re: COSB.  Parents would like defendant to come home.  Both agree to COSB.     $1000 COSB  bond on each of the 3 files. cosigned by parents, Robert Sobbe 12/15/72 and Dawn Sobbe, 2/17/76.  No weapons in the house, all guns to be removed from the house.   no violent contact with his brother or other victim.  No drugs or alcohol to be monitored by ZCI.  Attend self help groups, 5 per week, in Burlington.  Defendant must go to ZCI today.     15CF1368  no violent contact with brother.    Defendant waives his time limits on both new cases.  Waiver approved.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
